dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 1180 IH: To repeal the Impoundment Control Act of 1974.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Clyde (for himself, Mr. Self, Mr. Biggs of Arizona, Mrs. Miller of Illinois, Mr. Donalds, Ms. Boebert, Mr. Moore of Alabama, Mr. Higgins of Louisiana, Mr. Burlison, Mr. Burchett, Mr. Roy, Mr. Nehls, Mr. Crane, Mr. Hunt, Mr. Steube, Mr. Harris of North Carolina, Mr. Tiffany, Ms. Greene of Georgia, Mr. Weber of Texas, Mr. Harris of Maryland, Mr. Gosar, Mr. Gill of Texas, Mr. Amodei of Nevada, Mr. Cline, Mr. Mills, and Mrs. Spartz) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Budget, and in addition to the Committee on Rules, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To repeal the Impoundment Control Act of 1974.

section.header: Repeal of Impoundment Control Act of 1974
section.text: The Impoundment Control Act of 1974 (2 U.S.C. 681 et seq.) is hereby repealed.
